dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Ashlee Dawn! Ashlee pounces on her brother sleeping in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up! Ashlee pounces again. Ree drops fat into a hot skillet. She cuts a potato and d the pieces into the hissing fat. The radio music becomes newscast reporting the cold weather conditions. Ashlee, wrapped in a blanket, watches Ree at the stove.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Morning. Ree opens the fridge and pokes around for something to gi the dog. She takes out a bowl, smells what’s inside and h it to Ashlee.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Better than nothing. Ashlee heads outside to give the dog his food. EXT. REE’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Ashlee carries the dog’s food across the yard. NICKDOG, t family hound, greets her enthusiastically. She places the bowl on the ground. INT. REE’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS Ree combs her mother’s wet hair. A hymn plays on the radi Sonny enters, holding a dog.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peanut Butter.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Where’d you find Peanut Butter?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: In the woods.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He’s sweet. Ree and her mother pet the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree, Sonny, Ashlee and two dogs are walking to school.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Spell ‘house’.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: A-woo.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ssssss.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: H-O-U-S-E. Seven plus two.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Nine.  Good. INT. SCHOOL, CHILDREN’S CLASSROOM - DAY Ashlee does an art project at a table with other children Ree watches her and then walks down the hallway to the hi school wing of the K-12 school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parenting class. The STUDENTS each hold a mechanical ba and follow the TEACHER’S instructions. Ree watches from t hallway.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Transfer. Careful. Cradle the head. And then take him to your shoulder. So he’s up a little bit higher, but you’re still supporting the head. Make sure you hold this right under... Shots of the teens in the class earnestly trying to hold their model babies correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROTC students march down hallway with rifles and turn to enter the gym. Ree approaches from the opposite direction

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON P.A. SYSTEM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Could I have your attention, please? Forsyth Misouri chapter of the Family, Consumer and Career leaders of America... One of Ree’s former classmates sees her and waves.

dialogues.speaker: ROTC GIRL IN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Hey, Ree.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON P.A. SYSTEM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: +. will meet this Friday at 3:00pm in Mrs. Blair’s room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front and Center.

dialogues.speaker: INT SCHOOL HALLWAY
dialogues.text: From a doorway we see ROTC students drilling in the gym. Ree watches them through the window.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON P.A. SYSTEM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Truman University will be here next Monday at 8:45.

dialogues.speaker: ROTC DRILL LEADER 2
dialogues.text: Forward, march!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON P.A. SYSTEM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If you would like to attend, please sign up in the counselor’s office.

dialogues.speaker: ROTC DRILL LEADER 2
dialogues.text: Forward, march!

dialogues.speaker: ROTC DRILL LEADER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alignment...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON P.A. SYSTEM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The Marine Corps Birthday Ball will be this Saturday evening. All ROTC cadets and their families are encouraged to attend. Ree signs up at a clipboard. EXT. BLOND MILTON’S YARD - DAY SONYA, Ree’s relative, is feeding her horses in her barn area. Sonya and her husband live across the holler from Ree’s family.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: (To the horses) Alright. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree leads a horse across a wintry yard to Sonya’s barn ar  EXT. BLOND MILTON’S YARD - DAY Ree walks towards the barn.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Hi Sonya.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Hey Ree. Sonya puts down the pitchfork and faces Ree.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: You and the kids alright?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: We're just a little short on cash right now.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: How long’s it been since the horse ate?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: About four days.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: That hay gets kind of expensive, don’t it?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Yes ma’am. (beat) Actually, I was wondering if you could keep her with yours? After a long pause, Sonya opens the gate to the pasture a ushers Ree’s horse in to join the others.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: (to Ree’s horse) Alright, Ginger, Come on in. Come on. There you go. Have a little bit of that. Come on. Get going.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sonya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Ree takes a last look at her horse and retraces her steps across the yard. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree chops wood. She’s got headphones on and the music is fueling her chopping. There is the sound of a car approaching. Nickdog barks an runs across the yard to greet the car. Ree’s relatives, Sonya and her husband, BLOND MILTON, are skinning a deer in their yard. They look up to see who’s approaching. As the car gets closer, Ree can see that it police car. She throws down her axe and approaches the ca as it pulls to a stop. SHERIFF BASKIN, 30's, gets out. Ree climbs the porch step and blocks the front door of her house. EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: How are you today? Ree doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Ask me inside. I need to talk some with your mama. Ree opens the door and steps aside.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: She don’t talk much. Sheriff Baskin enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ma’am? I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions. (beat) Ma‘ am?  Ree can hear that her mother is not responding. Baskin returns to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You better just tell me. Baskin positions himself directly across from Ree and lea against the porch post.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: You know your daddy’s out on bond, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Looks like he’s been cooking again.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I know that’s the charges you laid on him, but you ain’t proved it on him. You got to prove it every time.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Well, that won’t be no hard thing to do. But that ain’t even why I’m here. His court date’s next week, and I can’t seem to turn him up.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Maybe he sees you and ducks.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: That could be. But where you all come into this is, he put this house here, and your timber acres up for his bond.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He what now?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Jessup signed over everything. If he doesn’t show at trial, see, the way the deal works is, you all gonna lose this place. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF BASKIN (cont'd) (beat) You got some place to go? Shock courses through Ree, but she tries to mask it.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’ll find him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Girl, I’ve been lookin’.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I said I’1l find him. Baskin looks out across the property. He sees Blond Milto scoping him out. After a moment Baskin turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: You make sure your daddy knows the gravity of this deal. Baskin drives away. Blond Milton and Sonya resume skinnin their deer. Sonny carries split wood to the porch and stands next to watching Sonya and Blond cut down the hanging meat in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Maybe they’1ll share some of that with us.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: That could be.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Maybe we should ask. Ree looks at her little brother, holding his chin in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Never ask for what oughtta be offered. INT. REE’S HOUSE - EVENING Ashlee and Sonny are warming themselves by the wood stove Sonya enters, carrying in a large cardboard box that has venison bone jutting above the rim.  11.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Evening, Ree.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Evening.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Kids. Hey, Connie. Didn’t want you to think we’d forgot y’all. Sonya sets the box on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Brought you some meat, some potatoes, and some stuff for a good stew, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you. We can use it.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Seen your woodpile’s low out front. We got that splitter up there in the yard. You should use it.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’1l do that.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: We seen the law was out here this afternoon. Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He’s hunting for Dad. Sonny, listening to the conversation, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Hunting Jessup is he? You know where he’s at?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Yes.  12.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, well I guess you didn’t have nothing to tell him, then, did you?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I wouldn't tell him nothing if I did.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: Oh, we know that. I’m gonna let you get to it, alright? Sonya leaves abruptly, waving goodbye to Connie and pulli the door shut behind her. Ree looks at her brother and sister.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: How about some deer stew - that sound good?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Alright, both of you need to get over here and watch how I make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree walks along a brambly road and turns off into a drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree crosses the yard and climbs a porch. She knocks on th door and stands, waiting. She can hear thrash metal music coming from inside. The door is opened by GAIL, 17, holdi her baby NED.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Thank god it’s you, Sweet Pea, and not Floyd’s mommy and daddy again. Them two watch me like I done something wrong.  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLOYD, 18, is pulling on the boots to his ATV outfit.

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: Would you hush your mouth about them. They put a roof over your head ain’t they?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Hey, Floyd. You gonna invite me in? Or I could just stay out here and talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: Yeah, you can come in. Ree steps inside the house and walks past Floyd to the kitchen. INT. GAIL’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY Gail holds Ned. She hugs Ree.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Hey. Ree takes in Ned and the fact that her best friend now ha baby. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Don’t start. Come on. Gail carries Ned down the narrow hall to the bedroom. Ree follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree flops down on the bed. Gail lies down next to her, putting Ned between them.  14.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: It’s been a while, Sweet Pea.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Things stack up is all.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: The sheriff came by looking for my Dad. If he don’t show up for his court date, we’re gonna lose the house. Gotta get down to the Arkansas line.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I gotta ask him. It’s his truck. Gail gets up and leaves the room. Ree holds Ned while Gai talks to Floyd. Gail returns.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: He said no.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Did you tell him I'd spring for gas?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I told him. He still won't.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: He never says why not to me, Ree. He just says no.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Man, that’s so sad to hear you say he won't let you do something, and then you don’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: It’s different once you’re married. Gail flops back onto the bed.  15.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: It really must be. Cause you ain’t never used to eat no shit.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Ned needs his nap. Gail takes Ned from Ree’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: (whispers to baby) Come here. Ree leaves and Gail watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree treks up a wooded hill. EXT. TEARDROP’S YARD - DAY Ree enters the yard, greeted by dogs. VICTORIA, 30's, opens the door of a rough-hewn brown pain cabin.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What brings you here? Somebody dead?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m looking for my Dad. Victoria holds the door for Ree and beckons her inside.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Come on in. Shake off the chill. Ree enters the house, followed by Victoria. INT. TEARDROP’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY Ree and Victoria enter kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Let’s keep it quiet. Teardrop’s still laying up in bed.  16. Ree takes off her coat and sits down at the table. Victor pours two cups of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: The law came by today. Dad signed over everything to his bond. Victoria, I really gotta run Dad down to get him to show. Ree’s uncle, TEARDROP, 40’s, a worn, unshaven man enters. lights a cigarette and crosses the room.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: You ought not do that. Don’t go running after Jessup. Teardrop sits at the table.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show or don’t show that choice is up to the one going to jail, not you.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You know where he’s at, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Where a man’s at ain’t necessarily for you to know neither.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: But you do... Teardrop abruptly shoots a warning look at Ree.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I ain’t seen him. Victoria places a cup of coffee in front of him. Silence while Ree contemplates her next move.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Could be running around with Little Arthur and them, you think? Teardrop absentmindedly loads the magazine of a pistol.  17.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Don’t you ever go down around Little Arthur’s asking them people about shit they ain’t offering to talk about. That’s a real good way to end up et by hogs, or wishing you was.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: We're all related ain’t we? Teardrop continues to fiddle with the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Our relations get watered kinda thin between here and Little Arthur's. Teardrop tosses the pistol onto the lazy susan in the mid of the table.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You know all those people, Teardrop. You could ask.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: None of them’s gonna be in a great big hurry to tangle with you.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I said shut up once already with my mouth. Teardrop gets up and walks across the kitchen to the stov with his back to Ree.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dad’s your only brother. Teardrop spins back to face her.  18.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: You think I forgot that? Hmm? Jessup and me run together for coming on forty years but I don’t know where he’s at, and I ain’t going to go around asking after him neither. Victoria tries to cut the tension by changing the subject

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Ree, you still planning to join the army?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think I can any more. (to Teardrop) Listen... Teardrop lunges at Ree, grabs her hair and pulls her face back to look at him. He leans his face in very close to hers.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No. He lets her go and exits the kitchen. Victoria locks eyes with Ree, then follows Teardrop. Ree, sitting at the table, can hear their muffled voices the next room. She rises and puts on her coat as they arg

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She needs help.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nope. Nope. listen. Listen! You tell that girl to stay close to home. Don’t move. Give her this. You send her ass on her way right now. Victoria comes back into the kitchen.  19.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Teardrop says you best keep your ass real close to the willows, dear. He hopes this helps. Victoria presses a wad of bills into Ree’s hand. She slip joint out of her cigarette package. VICTORIA (CONT’D) Here's a doobie for your walk. Ree takes the joint.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Victoria stares at Ree as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree hikes across a ruddy pasture strewn with dilapidated sheds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree crosses the road and heads up a hill. EXT. MEGAN’S YARD - LATE AFTERNOON Ree enters a yard with laundry hanging on a line. A donke grazing on the other side of the fence. A half-eaten appl has rolled out of his reach. She picks it up and feeds it the donkey. MEGAN, 20, comes out onto the porch and calls out to Ree.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Hey! What’s your business here?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: My dad’s, Jessup. He’s pals with Little Arthur, and I gotta find him. Megan stares Ree down, taking a long time to answer.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Hold on.  20. Megan goes inside the house. Ree takes in the details of yard. The wind strikes up, ominous clanking sounds surrou her. Megan comes back out with her coat on, approaches Ree, an guides her through the densely packed debris in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: My name’s Megan, and I do know you, really. Seen you at some of the reunions. I knew Jessup when I seen him, too. Never did talk with him much.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You knew him?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Knew him when I seen him around, I mean. He does stuff I hear about.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He cooks crank.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: They all do now. You don’t even need to say it out loud. INT. LITTLE ARTHUR’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON LITTLE ARTHUR, mid-30s, nervously looks out his window. EXT. LITTLE ARTHUR’S YARD - AFTERNOON Megan and Ree approach Little Arthur’s house.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: If Arthur’s been runnin’ on crank for a day or two, you should just leave, okay? The door opens and Little Arthur smiles at Ree.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I knew it - I been in your dreams, ain’t I, little Ruthie?  21.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: It’s Ree, you asshole. And I’m only out to find Dad.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Come on in, ladies. Ree pushes past Megan and enters the house. Megan follows INT. LITTLE ARTHUR’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON No fresh light makes its way through the windows. Little Arthur shows affection to his pet ferret, tapping on the glass of the tank. Ree and Megan hover near the door and watch him from the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: This don’t gotta take long, man. I’m looking for Dad and thought maybe you’d been seeing him, maybe you two been getting into stuff together again. He turns away from the ferret and sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Not since the summer. At y’all’s place.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You ain’t seen him nowhere since then?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Huh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He kept leavin’ the house goin’ someplace- you don’t know where?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You got cat shit in your ear, girl?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’ve got them two boys and Mom to tend, man. I need him.  22.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: If I see the dude, I’11 tell him you said that. Little Arthur lights a cigarette, his hands shaking.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Your dad left you to do all that? That’s fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Well, he had to, the way things go, you know. Ree stares at Arthur. He lurches forward on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You want a line?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You wanna blow some smoke?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No. Little Arthur slaps the table and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Then I guess I got nothing for you. He waves his hand to dismiss them.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on! Ree and Megan waste no time leaving. Arthur watches them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan and Ree walk up the road.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Don’t tell nobody it was me who told you this, okay? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEGAN (cont'd) But you’re going to have to go on up the hill and ask for a talk with Thump Milton. Now, I hope he’1l talk with you - he generally won't.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: That man, scares me way more than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Well, scared ain’t a bad way to be about him, neither, hon. He’s my own granpaw, and I still make damn sure I never piss him off none. They continue walking until they reach Megan's property. EXT. MEGAN’S YARD - AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You go see Thump. Megan holds down a barbed wire fence to allow Ree to clim over it.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. Ree heads up the hill while Megan watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree trudges through the woods. Dry leaves and branches crackle under her footsteps as she makes her way. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - AFTERNOON MERAB, 50’s, comes out to the porch of her house. Ree crosses the yard. Dogs herald her arrival with loud barki

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: You’ve got the wrong place, I expect. Who might you be?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m Ree. My Dad’s Jessup Dolly.  24. Merab gestures for Ree to come closer. Ree takes a few st towards the porch.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: You ain’t here for trouble, are you?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Cause one of my nephews is Buster Leroy, and didn’t he shoot your daddy one time?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Yes'm, but that ain’t got nothing to do with me. They settled all that theirselves, I think.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Shooting him likely settled it. What is it you want?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I got a real bad need to talk with Thump.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: And he ain’t got no need to talk to you. Merab turns away towards her doorway.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: But I need to. I really, really got to ma’am. Please! Merab turns around to face Ree.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some of our blood at least is the same. Ain’t that s’posed to mean something’ - isn’t that what is always said? Merab, irritated, moves to confront Ree.  25.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Ain’t you got no men could do this?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No, Ma’am, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: You go wait in the yard somewhere by that coop, and I’1l tell Thump you're here.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Ree walks in the direction of the chicken coop. Merab goe inside. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - AFTERNOON Ree finds a place to sit next to the coop. The camera lingers on the various things Ree notices as s waits.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Come on, already. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - LATE AFTERNOON Merab comes back outside carrying a mug and calls out to

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: He ain’t likely to have time for you, child.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’ve got to talk to him. If he don’t know, nobody does.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Nope. Talking just causes witnesses. And he don’t want for any of those.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I'll wait.  26.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: You need to get yourself on home. She gives Ree the mug.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Here, drink it down and be on your way. Ree drinks and hands the empty mug back to Merab.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Thump knows you were in the valley, child. With Megan. And at Little Arthur’s. He knows what you want to ask, and he don’t want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: And that’s it? He ain’t gonna say nothing to me?

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: If you’re listening, child, you got your answer. Merab turns her back and walks toward her house. Ree call after her.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: So, I guess come the nut-cutting, blood don’t really mean shit to the big man. Am I understanding that right? Merab spins on her heel and gets up into Ree’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare. Don’t! I want you to listen to me, child. You need to turn around, and get yourself on home. Merab turns and walks back to her house. As she reaches t doorstep, she turns back towards Ree.  27. MERAB (CONT’D) Don’t you make me come out here and tell you again! Merab enters the house and slams the door. As Ree stomps away, Merab eyes her suspiciously from the window. EXT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ashlee bounces on the trampoline on a toy horse. Ree comes out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ashlee Dawn, come inside. Bring Brownie and Cupcake. Ashlee picks up the two horses and climbs off the trampol INT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ree is slicing potatoes into a sizzling pan. There is a loud knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ree, Get out here! EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY Ree opens the door and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Do you know, there’s people going ‘round saying you best shut up. People you ought to listen to. Get your ass in the truck. He grabs Ree’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Get your ass in the truck.  28. Blond Milton pushes Ree towards the truck. Ree grabs the porch beam to resist. Blond Milton shoves her down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Get off!

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Get in the truck! Sonny comes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: D’ruther I hit you, boy?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Sonny, get back in the house. Cook them taters ‘til they’re brown then turn the stove off.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Don’t hurt my sister.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Sonny! Blond Milton turns around, climbs the porch steps and gra Sonny’s collar.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Having balls is good, boy, but don’t let ‘em get you hurt.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Sonny, get in the house!

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: (to Ree) Get your dumb ass in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m not getting in there with you.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Get in the truck. There’s something that you need to see.  29. Ree and Blond Milton get into the truck. INT. BLOND MILTON’S TRUCK - DAY (DRIVING)

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Jessup and me may have had our tussles, but he was my cousin. It’s always a bad deal when these things blow.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Down the road.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Down the road to where?

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: To someplace you need to see. Ree anxiously looks around trying to get her bearings.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BLOND MILTON'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: They drive past woodlands until they reach a burned out house. Blond Milton pulls off the road and turns off the engine. INT. BLOND MILTON’S TRUCK - DAY (STATIONARY )

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: This right here is the last place me or anybody seen Jessup.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He never blew no lab before.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: I know it. But something must have jumped wrong this time.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He’s known for never fucking up labs or cooking bad batches. He’s known for knowing what he’s doing.  30.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Well, you cook long enough, this is bound to happen.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You saying Dad’s up there burnt to a crisp?

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: That's what I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m going’ up for a look. Ree opens her door and starts to exit the truck. Blond Mi grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: No! That shit’s poison. It'll rip the skin off your bones!

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: If Dad’s up there, I’m bringing him home to bury.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Ree! Ree wrests herself free and gets out of the truck, slammi the door behind her. Blond watches as she approaches the ruined house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree walks across the road to the burned out house. She cautiously approaches the house, looking at the detai of the wreckage. One wall is blown out to the yard, windo have exploded and the blackened wall fragments and insula dangle from the broken studs. She takes in a melted stove and notes weeds growing throu the floorboards. INT. BLOND MILTON’S TRUCK - DAY (DRIVING) Ree and Blond Milton drive home silently. Ree looks out t window, lost in thought, weighing her options.  31. EXT. BLOND MILTON’S HOUSE - DAY Blond Milton and Ree get out of the truck in front of his house. He stops Ree as she starts to walk home across the holler. Ree walks

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: I know losing Jessup leaves you all hurting over there. I know it’s a lot to handle.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: We'll make do.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: Sonya and me talked about it. We feel we could take Sonny off your hands. Not Ashlee, I don’t reckon, but we could take Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: We could take him and raise him up the rest of the way.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: My ass, you will.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MILTON
dialogues.text: We'd raise the boy way better’n you and that nut job mama of yours can. Maybe on down the line we'd take Ashlee, too.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You go straight to hell, you son of a bitch. Sonny and Ashlee will die living in a cave with me and Mama before they spend one night with you. away, then turns back to Blond Milton.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn you! You must think I'ma stupid idiot. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s weeds growing chin high in that place. It must have been a year since that place blew! Ree spits at Blond Milton’s feet. He turns and leaves. Re angrily marches back across the holler to her house. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Sonny and Ashlee place plastic bottles on a picnic table, then run back to where Ree is waiting. Ree props up a double-barrelled shotgun for Sonny and Ash to examine.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Come here, look at this. Ash, quit playing around, c’mere. This trigger shoots this barrel, this trigger shoots this barrel. Now there’s hardly ever gonna be a time where you need both. But if you gotta kill something big and mean, then you use both. Ree puts the double-barreled gun on the ground and picks the other shotgun that’s lying there.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now this gun is what you’ll use when you’re older. But this one is the gun I learned on. This is Daddy’s squirrel gun. Now the most important thing is do not put your finger on the trigger unless you're ready to shoot, you’re aimed at your target. And don’t ever-- both of you look at me-- never point this at each other, not ever. Alright? Kneel down like you’re praying. Yeah, just like that. Yup. Sonny picks up the gun and rests it on his shoulder. Ree stands over him instructing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that cross? It’s called the crosshairs. Aim that up at the middle of your target. And when that’s lined up in the middle then you squeeze the trigger and you shoot. Sonny shoots.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: Ree!

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Hang on. (to Gail) Hey! (to Sonny and Ashlee) Both of you sit on your hands. Don’t touch it. Gail enters with her baby in a baby carrier.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Damn, Sweet Pea. What’s with all the guns?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Just teaching them a little bit of survival. Ree takes a peek at Ned in the carrier.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Ned) Hi! 33. Ree hugs her.  34. INT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ree and Gail are standing at the kitchen counter. Ned is the counter inside the carrier. Gail tosses a set of keys up onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Got the truck off him.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You are who I always did think you were, Darlin’. You truly are. EXT. REE’S YARD - NIGHT Gail and Ree come out of Ree’s house. Gail carries Ned in carrier. They open the doors of Floyd’s truck and secure carrier in place.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Turn it this way.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Backwards?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Yup. Does your mom know what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m not sure.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: You think you should tell her?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: This is the exact shit she went crazy trying to get away from. It'd be too mean to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I guess she couldn’t help, anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Nope. They climb into the truck and drive away.  35. INT. APRIL’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A picking session is in process. MARIDETH, APRIL’s mother sings, accompanied by her friends playing music. April si on the couch watching. In another part of the room, two couples play cards.

dialogues.speaker: MARIDETH
dialogues.text: (sings) As I look on that valley far below. It’s green as far as I can see. As my memories return, oh how my heart does yearn For you and the days that used to be. High on a mountain, wind blowing free, I wonder if you still remember me. Marideth turns to her friends.

dialogues.speaker: MARIDETH
dialogues.text: Play it through. Ree and Gail (with baby carrier) knock at the door. April gets up to answer their knock.

dialogues.speaker: MARIDETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sings) I wonder if you still remember me Or has time erased your memory? As I listen to the breeze whisper gently through the trees, I wonder if you still remember me. April opens the door and hesitates before greeting Ree.

dialogues.speaker: MARIDETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sings) Come all ye fair and tender ladies, Take a warning how you court your men.

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: Come on in.  36. She motions Ree and Gail in. They step inside quietly and survey the scene, checking to see if they know anyone. APRIL (CONT’D) It’s Ma’s birthday.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: You want anything? Something to drink, food?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m here huntin’ Dad.

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: I was guessin’ that. Come on in. April leads Ree and Gail through the living room to her daughter’s bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MARIDETH
dialogues.text: (sings) They're like a star on a a summer morning They first appear and then they’re gone. I wish I was a little sparrow And I had wings and I could fly. I'd fly straight away... INT. APRIL’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT In the cramped kids room, Gail and Ree pay close attentio April.

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: You know me’n Jessup quit keepin’ company a good while ago.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I figured. I thought you might still know a thing or two.  37.

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: Well, I’m kind of afraid I might. I wish I could kick back for this one, Ree. April sits down next to them.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You still bad on the bottle?

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: No, no, I give that up. A couple months ago Jessup and me run across each other by total accident. He got me to laughing so, things rekindled for a day or two. Then he was gone again. Then about, maybe, three or four weeks back, I'd stopped at Cruikshank’s, he was in there with three fellas I didn’t know, and they didn’t look to be having no fun, either.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Dad say anything?

dialogues.speaker: APRIL
dialogues.text: He looked square at me, but acted like he didn’t know me, like he'd never seen me before. Something real wrong was going on. Ree is lost in her thoughts trying to take this in. April tries to look her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: APRIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree, Sonny and Ashlee sit silently with their back agains large oak. Ree holds a shotgun propped and ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: If you stay really still and quiet, they’11 come out. Sonny sneezes.  38.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bless you.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: How long do we have to wait for a squirrel?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: A long time, usually.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Wish we could get deer.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: It’s not time for deer.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: When is it?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: In the morning or at night. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: (whispers to Ree) Do you see one?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Mmm. Where? Ashlee points.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: (whispering) There.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ah! Help me pull the trigger. Put your finger right there. Ree and Ashlee shoot. EXT. REE’S YARD, SKINNING TABLE - MORNING Ashlee and Sonny lay three squirrels on the skinning tabl Ree puts down a bucket.  39.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Alright, you want these fried or stewed?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY, ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Fried.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Fried? Alright. Ree grabs a knife and begins to skin the squirrel. Gail approaches with a mug of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Hey. Ree starts to work the knife under the skin.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Alright. Now get your fingers in there, and I’1l get mine in. One, two, three. Ree and Sonny pull at opposite ends of the squirrel’s ski

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pull. Pull hard. They continue to pulling.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I’m just gonna slit it down here. She begins to slice the squirrel’s flesh.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now get in there and get them guts out.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to.  40.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Sonny, there’s a bunch of stuff that you’re going to have to get over being scared of. Sonny backs away.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I’m not scared, I just don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Come on. Put your fingers in there. Ree guides Sonny’s hand inside the squirrel.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Good. Sonny pulls out a long strand of entrails.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Do we eat those parts?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Not yet. EXT. BLOND MILTON’S HOUSE, WOODSHED - DAY Ree operates the wood splitter. Teardrop approaches her silently and turns the engine off. Startled, Ree spins around.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: You think I forgot about you?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Forgot about you and everything happening over here.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: That’s your business - you forget us if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law found Jessup’s car at Gullet Lake this morning. Somebody set fire to it last night, burnt it down to nothing almost. (beat) He wasn’t in it. Ree looks away, then turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He’s gone, ain’t he? Teardrop takes a wad of folded bills from inside his jack and hands it to Ree.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: This is for you all. His court day was this morning and he didn’t show. I'd sell off your timber land now while you can.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No, huh-uh. I won’t be doing nothing like that.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: That's the very first thing they’1l do - Teardrop takes her chin in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - once they’ve took this place from under you all, girl. Go out and cut them 100 year old woods down to nubs. Might as well have the dough to spend on your own. Teardrop slips a bag of crank from his pocket and scoops bit out with a key and snorts. Ree looks away. the bag of crank at her.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: You get the taste for it yet?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Not so far.  42.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Suit yourself, little girl. Them pills help your mama’s mood any?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: She keeps taking them, but they ain't working.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Tell her ‘hey.’ Teardrop slowly walks away. Ree stares after him. INT. REE’S HOUSE, CONNIE’S BEDROOM - DAY Ree stands in front of her parents’ closet looking at Jessup’s things. She fingers his clothes and stares at hi small collection of boots, remembering him. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree’s brother and sister sense the tension surrounding th Ashlee cuddles a dog. Sonny drapes himself over the trampoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree takes her mother’s arm, guiding her over stumps and r as they walk into the woods on their property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie and Ree sit among the trees.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Mom, look at me. Connie stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: There’s things happening, and I don’t know what to do. Ree waits for her mother to respond.  43.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you please help me this one time? Mom? Mom, look at me. Connie looks vaguely in Ree’s direction.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Teardrop thinks I should sell the woods, Mom. Should I sell? Please, help me this one time. Ree turns away, helpless and trying to hold back her tear

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to do. The wind gently blows through the woods, and the clouds r in. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Gail and Ree slowly drive the truck along the rut road up Ree’s house. Waiting near the house is a stranger standin his car. Blond and CATFISH MILTON keep watch from across scrabble.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who he hell is he?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Judging by that car, he ain’t from our neck of the woods. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY The truck pulls up and MIKE SATTERFIELD, displaying a bad approaches Ree as she gets out.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: I’m Mike Satterfield, A-1 Bonds.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What is it you want?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: We hold the bond on Jessup Dolly and now he’s a runner, it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Dad ain’t no runner.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: He didn’t show for court - that makes him a runner. (to Gail) Will you excuse us, please. Go on! Ree hands a bag of groceries to Gail. Gail takes Ned up t the porch and listens to the conversation from there. SATTERFIELD (CONT’D) Look, I don’t want to kick your dad's ass, alright? I just want to keep the judge off mine.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Dad's dead. He didn’t show for court ‘cause he’s lying dead somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: A couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Who's he running around with? Where they all hanging out?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He doesn’t tell me that stuff, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Now, you know I’ve got the legal right to go in there hunting the man any place I want?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I know you’d be wasting your time and pissing me off. Jessup Dolly is dead. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REE (cont'd) He’s lying in a crappy grave somewhere or become piles of shit in a hog pen. Maybe he’s been left out plain in the open, but wherever he is, he’s there dead.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: And you know this how?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You must’ve heard what Dolly’s are, ain't you, mister?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Well, I’ve heard what some are anyhow, and I have bonded a few.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m a Dolly, bred’n buttered, and that’s how I know Dad’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Seventeen. Satterfield takes this in, not sure how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: You know, uh, your daddy was short on his bond. This house and stuff here couldn't cover it, not nearly - did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I didn’t know nothing. They told me everything after.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Well, he was short on his bond. Then this fella comes in the office one evening, got him a sack full of crinkled money and just laid it down right there to cover the rest. Seemed like somebody needed him sprung in a hurry.  46.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: This fella with the money have a name?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Shit, no. Probably left that in his other pants. Gail looks on from the porch, listening intently, concern trying to make sense of Satterfield’s story.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: How long before we get kicked off our own property?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: I reckon...I reckon y'all got this place about another week. That’s my guess.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: A week? And there ain’t nothing I can do?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Nope. There ain’t nothing left to do, unless you can prove he’s dead. Satterfield turns to go, and calls out to Catfish and Blo Milton. SATTERFIELD (CONT’D) Catfish, Blond, you boys staying out of trouble? Blond flips him the bird. Satterfield gets in his car and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cattle auction is underway. The auctioneer rattles off prices to a crowd. Ree enters and searches the crowd for THUMP MILTON, 60s. Thump sees her and leaves. Ree follows him.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking gingerly but intently along an elevated catwalk, searches for Thump amidst the massive maze of cattle pens below. The mooing of the cattle is deafening. Finally, Ree spots Thump. She tries to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: (shouting) Thump Milton! I need to talk to you! Thump Milton! Thump Milton! Thump! Ree’s voice competes with the din of the cattle. Thump Milton quickly leaves the area, and she runs down the cat after him. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - DUSK Ree walks across the yard towards Thump Milton’s house. The door opens and Merab comes out carrying a steaming mu She hurls the liquid at Ree, then hits her in the face wi the mug as ALICE and TILLY, Merab’s sisters, emerge from house. Ree cries out and falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: I done told you to leave him be. Merab and Alice grab Ree and drag her to the barn with Ti leading the way. Ree resists with all her strength. MERAB (CONT’D) Get her, Alice!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (to Ree) No, you don’t! The sisters get a tighter hold on her and force her insid the barn.  48.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: That’s what you get for not listening. Ree’s screams pierce the air as the barn door lowers. INT. THUMP MILTON’S BARN - NIGHT Ree regains consciousness in the glow of a fluorescent li She can see the rafters of the barn ceiling and a large assortment of metal tools and pieces of equipment all aro her. Merab stands over her.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: You was warned. You was warned nice and you wouldn’t listen - why didn’t you listen? Ree spits a bloody tooth into her palm. She looks around sees people she can barely make out, watching her in sile Among them she recognizes; Little Arthur, SPIDER MILTON, RAY. Megan bends down next to Ree and strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What are we ever gonna do with you, baby girl?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Kill me, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That idea has been said already. Got any others?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Help me. Ain’t nobody said that idea yet, have they?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I tried to help you some before, and this is what come of it. Megan backs away as Thump Milton enters the barn and walk to Ree. He grasps her chin and examines her bloody face, shooting a look at Merab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something to say, child, you best say it now. Ree thinks a minute, her eyes locked on Thump.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I got two kids who can’t feed themselves yet. My mom is sick, and she’s always gonna be sick. Pretty soon the laws are coming and taking our house and throwing us out to live in the field like dogs. Ree catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If Dad has done wrong, Dad has paid. And whoever killed him, I don’t need to know all that. But I can’t forever carry them kids, and my mom - not without that house. 49. She is met with silence. Thump leaves the barn with BOBBY Dogs bark outside as we hear the sound of an engine approaching.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER MILTON
dialogues.text: Aw, shit. Ray makes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I ain’t gonna stand here naked when that motherfucker comes in. Everyone can hear a truck door slam and heavy footsteps coming up the gravel. The barn door opens to reveal Teard

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Don’t get all excited, Teardrop. She was warned, and more than once. Teardrop gazes at Ree, his expression unchanging, then tu to Spider Milton.  50.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: You hit her? Spider Milton drops his arm to the small of his back, wrapping his hand around the gun tucked into his pants. Merab steps up to Teardrop.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: He never! No man here touched that crazy girl. I put the hurt on her. Me and my sisters, they was here too. Thump Milton walks back into the barn flanked by Ray and Bobby. He stops within an arm’s length of Teardrop.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: What Jessup done was against our ways, he knew it, I know it, and I ain’t raised no stink at all about whatever became of him. But she ain’t my brother. Teardrop looks around the gathering, finally locking eyes with Ree before concluding his case.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s about all the close family I got left, so I'll be collecting her now and carrying her on out of here to home. That suit you, Thump?

dialogues.speaker: THUMP MILTON
dialogues.text: You're gonna stand for her, are you?

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: If she does wrong, you can put it on me. Ree registers the gravity of this commitment on Teardrop’ part.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP MILTON
dialogues.text: She’s now yours to answer for.  51.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: This is a girl who ain’t gonna tell nobody nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP MILTON
dialogues.text: You boys give him a hand. Go on and put her in the truck. Little Arthur and Spider Milton shoulder Ree and walk her from the barn to the truck. The rest of the family in the barn watch Ree and Teardrop drive off. INT. TEARDROP’S TRUCK - NIGHT Teardrop drives Ree home. They park in front of the house but remain in the truck. Teardrop and rips a bandana and sticks the cloth into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Chomp down on that ‘til the blood lets up. Ree holds the cloth in her mouth. In the silence and dark of the truck, Teardrop levels wit Ree.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your daddy couldn’t face this last bust. Couldn’t face a ten year jolt. He started talking to the fucking sheriff. Teardrop takes a drag off his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You own me now. You understand? They been waiting to see if I’1ll do anything. Watching. I can’t know for a certain fact who went and killed my little brother. Even if you find out, you can’t ever let me know who killed him. Knowing that would just mean I’d be toes up myself pretty soon. Deal?  52. Ree reaches across the cab of the truck to squeeze Teardr shoulder. EXT. REE’S YARD - NIGHT Gail comes out of the house and runs to the truck. Ashlee and Sonny follow her and watch from the porch. Gail and Teardrop lift Ree from the truck and walk her towards the house, pushing Sonny aside.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: (to Sonny) No, get out of the way. Open the door. Teardrop closes the door to the house and lingers on the porch. INT. REE’S HOUSE, BATHROOM - NIGHT Gail carefully cleans Ree’s wounds with peroxide.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Gonna burn. Squeeze my hand. Ree rinses her mouth and spits more blood into the sink. sits, exhausted, appreciating Gail.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you. INT. REE’S HOUSE, BEDROOM - NIGHT Ree lies on the bed. Gail arranges packs of frozen vegetables over Ree’s bruised ribs. Sonya enters.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: I just heard. I brought these over for you. Sonya hands Gail a plastic vial.  53.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: They're painkillers. They’re real strong. These are gonna kick in real quick. Start with two.

dialogues.speaker: SONYA
dialogues.text: She’s gonna want more, just start with two and build from there, whatever number lets her rest.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Sonya leaves. Gail brings a glass of water to Ree’s lips and helps her swallow the pills.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Gail) Will you stay until I fall asleep first?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I will.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: But then make sure they’re doing their homework.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Alright. INT. REE’S HOUSE, BEDROOM - NIGHT Ree lies on her bed wafting in and out of consciousness. Sonny enters the room, places a glass of water on the nig stand and drops Ree’s tooth into it. He and Ashlee contemplate Ree for a moment before careful laying down next to her. Ashlee cradles Ree’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Does your arm hurt?  54.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: No. Not bad. Ree falls back asleep.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: REE’S DREAM Ree dreams through the painkillers. Abstract images of Oz wilderness and wildlife, sounds of chainsaws. INT. REE’S HOUSE, BEDROOM - NIGHT Ree wakes up from her dream, Ashlee and Sonny are sleepin beside her. EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY Ree and Gail stand on the porch with baby Ned, while Sonn and Ashlee jump on the trampoline. Gail tends to Ned. Ree, feeling worried and defeated, watches her brother and sister.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Blond Milton said him and Sonya would take Sonny in. I tell you that? Raise him up from here for me.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Does he know? Sonny?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Not from us. If he knows, it’s from somebody else blabbing, ‘cause I never. He doesn’t even know Dad cooks.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Well, if they took him, that might help some. What about Ashlee? Ree and Gail glance again at the two kids playing.  55.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: She don’t shine for them.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Well, what else can you do?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Beg Victoria and Teardrop to take Ashlee in.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: God, I hope that ain’t the way it goes, Sweet Pea. I hope to hell it ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army recruiter SGT. SCHALK, 30's, rises to shake hands wi student who he has just interviewed.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you. Have a good day, OK?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Thanks. Sgt. Schalk beckons Ree over.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Hi, how are you doing? Sergeant Schalk.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ree Dolly

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. So, what brought you down here today, Ree?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I wanted to find out more about the forty thousand dollars I get for signing up.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Well, that’s a good reason for joining, but why don’t you give me three better reasons for joining. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SGT. SCHALK (cont'd) Because once you join up, there’s no turning back, and it might not be worth forty thousand dollars to you.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Well, the main reason is I need the money. It’d be nice to travel, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: You know, five years is a long commitment.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Well, how long before I get the money?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Well, after you sign up it would be anywhere between fourteen weeks to eighty-two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Well, how come it doesn’t say that on the poster?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Probably a clerical error, or it just wasn’t on there. It might have been in fine print at the bottom. Do you mind me asking, what happened to your eye and your lip?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I fell off my bike.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Fell off a bike? Well, um, how old are you?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: You're seventeen. OK. Now, if this is something you really wanted to do, we’d have to bring Mom and Dad in on this, OK.  57.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I can sign for myself.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Not at seventeen you can’t. At seventeen you’re still considered a minor by the U. S. Government. OK? You have to be eighteen to sign up. Would it be a problem getting Mom and Dad in here? I mean, I can come out to you guys’ house and-

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: My mom’s sick. My dad’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Well, do you have any brothers or sisters that might be able to help?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I got a little brother and a little sister, twelve and six.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Well, who’s taking care of them right now?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: You are? Is that why you need the forty thousand dollars?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Well, it sounds like it might be a bigger challenge just to stay home, you know, and actually take care of your brother and sister. Because you know you’re not going to be able to take them with you to training, right?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I thought maybe I could.  58.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Not right at the beginning. Plus, you wouldn’t be able to have them when you’re actually in the active duty army. Because who’s going to be there to take care of them if you have to go off and actually fight? Ree falls silent. SGT. SCHALK (CONT’D) So it sounds like right now, you need to buckle up and stay home. It’s going to take a lot of backbone and a lot of courage to stay home, but that I think is what you need to do right at this point. OK? Now, something might change here in the next year or so. You might decide this is what you want to do, you know? But don’t take it lightly, and don’t do it just for the money. You need to have a good reason to do this, OK?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Alright. Well, it was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. SCHALK
dialogues.text: Have a good day, OK?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Thank you. They rise and shake hands. Ree exits. INT. REE’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DUSK Ree is curled up in a chair next to the wood stove, lost thought. Ashlee and Sonny eat on the couch next to her.  59. INT. REE’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Ree sleeps on the couch. Teardrop appears and jostles her awake with his knee.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I’m tired of waiting around for shit to come down. Let’s get out and poke ‘em where they’re at and see what happens. Teardrop helps Ree up off the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small LOCAL BAND plays in the back. Teardrop sits at the end of the bar scrutinizing the crow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree is asleep in Teardrop’s truck. She wakes up and notic Ray standing with two other men in front of the gas stati across the street.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord. Ree gets out of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ree walks through the bar as patrons stare at her. She catches Teardrop’s eye and motions him outside. Teardrop follows her out.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ray and them are over there.  60. Ree gets back in the truck. Teardrop walks over to Ray an his buddies.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Ray!

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What do you want? I ain’t seen him. If I could help you, I would. There are certain things you can’t do.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I’m sick of this shit. You're useless as tits on a fuckin’ boar.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I don’t know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be much worse next time I come back, I’11 tell you that right now. Teardrop walks away. Ray yells at his back.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Best thing you could do is leave it alone, brother. Believe me. You come back up in here you gonna get you an ass whooping that won't quit.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Look what this shit already caused. Teardrop walks back to the truck and grabs an ax out of t trunk as Ree watches from the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: (whispering to herself) What the hell? Teardrop smashes the windshield of Ray’s truck with the a Ree cringes, not wanting to witness Teardrop’s out of con behavior.  61.

dialogues.speaker: RAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yells) Hey, what the hell you doing? Hey! It’s on now. It’s so on. Teardrop gets in the truck and pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: RAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yells) We're coming after you, dude. We're coming, and we’re bringing hell with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teardrop and Ree get out of the truck carrying flashlight and enter the cemetery gates. They walk among the graves.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Looking for humps that ain’t settled. Teardrop and Ree pick their way amongst the headstones, scanning the ground with their flashlights. They finally pause and Teardrop surveys the area.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: He ain’t here. Teardrop sits and lights a cigarette. Ree settles down ne to him. Wind rustles through the dry leaves.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: He ain’t anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: He’s somewhere. They walk out of the cemetery.  62. INT. TEARDROP’S TRUCK - NIGHT Teardrop fighting whirling to stop. Teardrop and Ree drive in silence, Ree dozing and Teardrop sleep. Ree jolts awake and notices flashing lights over the truck from behind. Teardrop makes no move A siren squawks.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Teardrop, you should stop. Just see what he wants. stops the truck and rolls down his window. EXT. TEARDROP’S TRUCK - NIGHT Sheriff Baskin approaches holding a flashlight as Teardro stares straight ahead. He halts a few feet from the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Get out of the truck, Teardrop. I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: It ain’t about you. You’re not in trouble. It’s about your brother. Teardrop watches Baskin in his side mirror. Teardrop’

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Nope. Tonight I ain’t doing a fucking thing you say. s hand closes around the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Get out of the truck and put your hands where I can see ‘em. Come on, get out.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Why’d you tell? Why? You went and got his ass killed. You happy now?  63. Baskin and Ree register Teardrop’s accusation. Baskin, apprehensive, makes eye contact with Ree and draws his pi from the holster. Attempting to regain control, he taps t side of the truck with his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: I know you. I know your family. Get out of the car now. Teardrop raises his rifle and rests it on the open window staring Baskin down in the side mirror. Baskin shifts uneasily, again looking to Ree.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Is this gonna be our time? Teardrop and Baskin hold each other’s eyes in the mirror Baskin slowly backs away, still brandishing his flashligh Teardrop fires up the engine and Baskin shines his flashl on Ree in the truck. Teardrop pulls out and leaves Baskin standing alone in the road. INT. REE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Teardrop and Ree sit on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What I really can’t stand is how I feel so ashamed--for Dad.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Well, he loved y’all. That’s where he went weak. Ree looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lots of us can be tough, plenty tough enough, and do it for a long stretch, too.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: But snitching.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: For lots’n lots of years he wasn’t. He wasn’t, he wasn’t, and then one day he was.  64. Teardrop snorts crank off a key as Ree watches him.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You always have scared me.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: That’s cause you’re smart. They fall silent. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree carries a heavy box of belongings out and begins throwing papers into a smoking barrel in the yard. INT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ree and Connie sort through a box of family photos.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Will you look through this stuff? See what you want to keep. Connie nods and starts to go through the box. Ree turns the pages of a photo album. Sonny and Ashlee lo on.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: That’s Dad. And Teardrop. She hands a small hand-carved wooden horse to Ashlee.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ashlee, you remember when dad made that for you?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Look at this guy with her. Sonny points to a photo of Jessup and Connie.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: That’s him?  65. Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: How old was he in that picture?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Probably around my age. They contemplate the photos. Ashlee arranges her horse on the table in front of her. Ree turns over a small portrait photo of a woman and read aloud the inscription on the back.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I don’t know how I ever latched on to someone like you, but I sure hope I can keep you interested in me forever. I love you and will always be true. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree watches the fire in the barrel, then heads back into house. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ashlee and Sonny climb on and around large bales of hay, playing hide and seek.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Ho! Found you! Found you! EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY Merab and her sister Alice knock at Ree’s front door. Aft waiting a beat, Merab knocks again. Ree comes out with a shotgun, livid. Merab and Alice are unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: We're going to fix your problem for you.  66.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Right now I’m feeling like blowing me a clean hole through your fucking guts.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: I know you do. But you won’t. You'll put that scatter gun away and come along with us.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You must think I’m crazy!

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: We'll take you to your daddy’s bones. We know the place. We need to put a stop to all this nonsense talk about us we’ve been having to hear.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I ain’t said a thing about you.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: I know. But everybody else has. Ree gestures with the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I’m bringing this.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: No, you won't bring that, either. You want his bones, you'll set that down and come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAT, Merab’s sister, opens the gate to the field. Merab drives through and parks in the field. Merab, Tilly and Alice get out.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: You can go on and take that sack off your head. Give it to me. Ree removes a burlap sack from her head and gets out of t car.  67.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Child, you might know where you are. If you do, you forget you know it. You get me? Ree nods. Merab pulls a chainsaw from the trunk and hands to Alice. Merab and Kat illuminate the ground with flashlights as M leads the group through the gathering darkness to the edg a pond. Cows moo plaintively. The sisters pull a rowboat from the underbrush. No one speaks. Merab, Alice and Ree get in. Kat puts the chainsaw in the boat and Merab paddl away from shore towards a tangle of branches in the middl the pond.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: He should be right there. You're gonna need to reach down and tug him up. Ree removes her coat and rolls up her sleeves. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: He ain’t deep. Ree plunges her arm into the pond, groping in the water.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Straight down. Can you feel of him? Ree shivers, feels something and gasps, recoiling. Merab shines a light on the water as Ree goes back in, horrifie but determined, grabbing a firm hold of an icy hand.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Alright now, take this. Merab lifts the chainsaw to Ree.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Well, how else you gonna get his hands?  68. No.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, child. Your daddy would want you to do this. Now here, take the saw. Ree looks to Merab and away, making no move to take the chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: She can’t do it, Merab. Merab sees that Alice is right.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Hold his arm out straight, child. Merab starts the saw and begins to cut. Ree sobs. She drops the severed hand in the boat. Her father’s body sinks away from her grasp.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Why’d you let go? You’re gonna need both hands, or sure as shit they’1l say he cut one off to keep from going to prison. They know that trick. Now reach back down in there, now - quick. Ree reaches back into the pond. She grabs hold of Jessup’ body again and hangs on. Merab revs the chainsaw and seve the second hand. Ree is stunned, Merab wraps her coat around her.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: (whispering) Let it go. Ree is motionless.

dialogues.speaker: MERAB
dialogues.text: Let's go, Alice. They row away, leaving an oily film on the water’s surfac  INT. SHERIFF’S OFFICE, WAITING ROOM - DAY Ree sits waiting for Baskin with a plastic bag on As she waits, the DISPATCHER answers radio calls. Baskin appears and motions for her to come inside

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: C’mon back. INT. SHERIFF’S OFFICE - DAY Ree places the sack on Baskin’s desk. He takes a and flinches.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: How in the hell did you come by these?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Someone flung them up on the porch last night.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Reckon I’11 run these straight over. The lab can tell me if they’re his.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: They're his. Those are my dad's hands.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: We'll know yes or no on that soon enough. I bet your dad would still be here if he was just growing his marijuana. 69. her lap. his office. look inside Ree restrains her urge to verbally assault him, and heads the door. SHERIFF BASKIN (CONT’D) Hey! I didn’t shoot the other night ‘cause you were there in the truck. He never backed me down. Ree leans against the doorway.  70.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: It looked to me like he did.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BASKIN
dialogues.text: Don’t you let me hear that’s the story getting around.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I don’t talk much about you, man. Ever. INT. REE’S HOUSE, CONNIE’S BEDROOM - DAY Ree stands in front of the closet looking at Jessup’s thi for a minute. She pulls out a banjo and lays it on the be EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ashlee pets Nickdog.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: You’re a good boy. Good boy. Ashlee comes over to the clothesline and helps Ree take t laundry down. Connie folds the clothes at a table nearby. Sonny sits on his skateboard, rolling back and forth on plywood laid on top of the scrabble. Teardrop approaches, carrying a small bundle.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Sonny. Hey, Ashlee. He unwraps two chicks and offers them to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I brung these for you two to raise up. Ashlee and Sonny each take one.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Satterfield’s car pulls into the yard. Teardrop looks at then turns to Ree.  71.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: What’s he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I have no idea. Satterfield approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: I know you.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Yup. Satterfield studies Ree a little more closely.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Looks like you earned this money with blood, kid. He reaches inside his coat, pulls out a brown paper bag a hands it to Ree. SATTERFIELD (CONT’D) That’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: How’s it mine?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Well that fella never did give a name. But he sure was good news for you all when he put that money down on Jessup.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Ain’t it still his, though?

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: You can use it a hell of a lot more than him. And he ain’t gonna come back for it neither, not the way things happened. We took our cut, and that there’s what’s left. That makes it yours. Sonny observes the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you did that.  72.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Bred’n buttered. I told you. Satterfield searches for the right thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: SATTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Well you take care, OK? He nods to Teardrop and walks away. Ree turns to look at Connie and their eyes meet. EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY Teardrop leans against the porch. Sonny, followed by Ashl comes down the steps and offers Teardrop the banjo.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Well, it’s been a long time. Back off a little, you make me nervous. Oh, shit. Sonny and Ashlee sit on the porch steps and Teardrop pick out a tune. Ree comes over and leans against the porch ne to him. After a moment, Teardrop stops playing and puts d the banjo.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was never good like your daddy was. He looks down, pauses. Something is heavy on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: I know who.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Jessup. I know who. He walks towards his truck. Ree looks down at the banjo.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: You should have this.  73. Teardrop turns back to her, and she offers him the banjo.

dialogues.speaker: TEARDROP
dialogues.text: Oh, no, you...I’11l let you keep it here for me. They stare at each other silently for a moment. Teardrop gets into his truck, and Ree watches him drive a Ree sits on the porch steps and Ashlee and Sonny join her either side, cradling their chicks.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Does that money mean you’re leavin’?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I ain’t leavin’ you guys. Why do you think that?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: We heard you talking about the Army. Are you wanting to leave us?

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: I'd be lost without the weight of you two on my back. Ree kisses her sister’s head.

dialogues.speaker: REE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I ain’t going anywhere. Ashlee hands her chick to Ree. She picks up the banjo whe Ree left it, sits back down on the porch, and strums.
